title: (x) Cartier logo script - custom designed {Tiff}
content:
Im in.... a bit of a pickle. I cannot figure out which font the Cartier logo is in. Can anyone help me?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312204022im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cartier_4459.jpg)
author: Tama Hoshi

comments.content:
Is it one of the Shelley triplets?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/shelley-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312204022/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/shelley-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/shelley-script/")
not quiet the C is off.... too much loopage
The r\_t combo is custom and the r looks custom too, since most of these scripts use a round r. The whole thing is custom, my guess.
Custom: The Cartier typeface was recently updated by Porchez Typofonderie.
hummm... ok, i just need the type face that it is mostly made out of though. I even went and looked up the history of cartier to try to find it. \*pouts\* this is proving to be a difficult task.
If its custom, its often exclusive - so only authorized design personal gets their hands on it.

If it's any help, here's the Cartier logo in vector format:

[http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=8617510&page=1&mtype=&b...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312204022/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=8617510&page=1&mtype=&brand_id=63538 "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=8617510&page=1&mtype=&brand\_id=63538")
